intro: Melilotus besserianus, commonly known as Siberian sweet clover, is a herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with trifoliate leaves and small, fragrant yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic effects.
